title: user-account
description: The User Account Object represents an instance of any type of user account, including but not limited to operating system, device, messaging service, and social media platform accounts.

type.description: The value of this property MUST be `user-account`.

extensions.description: The User Account Object defines the following extensions. In addition to these, producers MAY create their own. Extensions: unix-account-ext.

user_id.description: Specifies the identifier of the account.

account_login.description: Specifies the account login string, used in cases where the user_id property specifies something other than what a user would type when they login.

account_type.description: Specifies the type of the account. This is an open vocabulary and values SHOULD come from the account-type-ov vocabulary.

display_name.description: Specifies the display name of the account, to be shown in user interfaces, if applicable.

is_service_account.description: Indicates that the account is associated with a network service or system process (daemon), not a specific individual.

is_privileged.description: Specifies that the account has elevated privileges (i.e., in the case of root on Unix or the Windows Administrator account).

can_escalate_privs.description: Specifies that the account has the ability to escalate privileges (i.e., in the case of sudo on Unix or a Windows Domain Admin account).

is_disabled.description: Specifies if the account is disabled.

account_created.description: Specifies when the account was created.

account_expires.description: Specifies the expiration date of the account.

password_last_changed.description: Specifies when the account password was last changed.

account_first_login.description: Specifies when the account was first accessed.

account_last_login.description: Specifies when the account was last accessed.

^unix-account-ext$.description: The User Account Object defines the following extensions. In addition to these, producers MAY create their own.

gid.description: Specifies the primary group ID of the account.

groups.description: Specifies a list of names of groups that the account is a member of.

home_dir.description: Specifies the home directory of the account.

type.description: Indicates that this object is an Observable Object. The value of this property MUST be a valid Observable Object type name, but to allow for custom objects this has been removed from the schema.

description.description: Specifies a textual description of the Object.

extensions.description: Specifies any extensions of the object, as a dictionary.

..\\common\\timestamp.json.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.
